messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `routes/api.php`, I found that `App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\PostCommentController@index` is imported to process HTTP requests to the path `/v1/posts/{post}/comments`. I'll provide you with the contents of file `routes/api.php`, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to find files that contain the implementation of `App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\PostCommentController@index`. You must focus on the implementation itself and ignore unit tests or functional tests. You need to output a list of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations, ensuring that each path is relative to the project's directory. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

Try 'grep --help' for more information.
"}

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
- app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostCommentController.php

Explanation:
- The route /v1/posts/{post}/comments is wired to App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\PostCommentController@index in routes/api.php.
- The implementation of that index method is contained in app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostCommentController.php.
- The index method returns a paginated collection of comments for a given post, loading the author relation and ordering by latest, with a configurable limit (default 20). This file is the direct source of the handler logic for the index action.
